text: ADA wheels glue is a fully managed data
catalog and ETL service let's take a
closer look inside AWS glue you have a
fully managed data catalog which holds
all the information and metadata about
the data that you have available inside
your organization and it will run around
and trawl your data with the right
permissions to be able to discover and
catalog that data automatically and we
catalog either on a schedule or when
data changes it can automatically using
this data catalog generate customizable
transformation code in Python which you
can then run just as is or you can jump
in and customize inside an editor or
inside a notebook from there you can
take that code which is customized and
schedule it to run your ETL jobs monthly
weekly whenever you want and the entire
system under the hood is entirely
serviced so glue is going to provision
and manage your infrastructure under the
hood there are no servers to call and
provision and manage as you go through
and to get started with the workloads
you just need to do three things the
first thing you need to be able to do is
to build your data catalog here you can
just set up a simple trawler inside the
user interface inside glue they will run
around look into your s3 buckets and
identify the data the fields and the
types of information you can see there
the big int and so on that are stored
against that data and once you've got
this incredibly powerful data catalog
you can use that to do all sorts of ETL
workloads and to drive a lot of
automation so that your engineers can
focus on the differentiating pieces of
the ETL the second part is to go ahead
and generate and edit those
transformations so you can see here
we've got a source database we're going
to take their source database we're
gonna do a quick ETL we're going to
remove a column and then we're gonna
load it into s3 in park' format which is
exactly the format that athena can use
efficiently to run ad-hoc queries so
here all we have to do is click a couple
of buttons using the data that we have
in the store we can generate the Python
code which can be customized and then
you can just go ahead
run it as soon as you have it ready you
can just go ahead and schedule your jobs
this is by far and the most simple UI
that I think I've ever shown an audience
of this size and I'm unapologetic about
how easy and simple it is to use so you
can schedule them on your jobs reliably
and at scale without managing all the
infrastructure under the hood and we've
been very lucky to work with some
customers in the private beta for glue
and such as News Corp who are able to
take all of their content and they run
that exact workload they're able to take
that content transform it into park'
format and load it into a search table
which they then use Athena to query we
have folks like the OLX group which take
their real-time clickstream data and
then load it into a ws stitches and
transformations so they can analyze the
clickstream across millions of different
customers my tomorrows takes clinical
trials data and other medical
information and aggregates it final
ethics and OST have been doing a
fascinating project with Herman Miller
the furniture company to produce
connected furniture so this is censored
furniture which is connected to the
cloud they collect all of the sensor
information they ETL it are using glue
and then they're able to use that sensor
information to do automatic
economic assessment so they have a
machine learning model which sits up on
AWS they transform the data ready for
that machine learning model and then
they apply that machine learning model
to do automated economic assessment for
folks that have Herman Miller connected
furniture so an extremely broad set of
use cases from IOT to clickstream
information all the way through to
medical information and clinical trials
information already up and running with
glue and this will be available for all
customers starting today
